intro: Burchardia multiflora, commonly known as the common burrhead, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces clusters of small, spiny fruits. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, hairy texture. Burchardia multiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
